abstract: Super Tuesday may have been an important night for the presidential primary process, but Fox came away the big winner in the television ratings race, easily outpacing its rivals’ election coverage. As usual, “American Idol” led overall, drawing 27.8 million viewers at 8 p.m., according to Nielsen’s estimates. At 9 p.m., Fox’s “House” earned a similarly dominant 23.2 million viewers.
lead_paragraph: Super Tuesday may have been an important night for the presidential primary process, but Fox came away the big winner in the television ratings race, easily outpacing its rivals’ election coverage. As usual, “American Idol” led overall, drawing 27.8 million viewers at 8 p.m., according to Nielsen’s estimates. At 9 p.m., Fox’s “House” earned a similarly dominant 23.2 million viewers.

headline.main: Not Even the Primaries Can Dislodge ‘Idol’
